content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

dependent

Related words are:

- dependant
- subordinate
- parasitical

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to describe the word "dependent" without using any of these words:
- dependent (the target word itself)
- dependant (alternative spelling)
- subordinate (related concept)
- parasitical (related concept)

I need to create a clear, concise clue that will help the other player guess the word "dependent" without using any of these forbidden words.

Here are some key aspects of "dependent":
- Someone who relies on another person
- Not autonomous or self-sufficient
- Someone who needs support (financially, emotionally, physically)
- A person who is claimed on someone else's tax return
- Something contingent on something else

I'll try to craft a clue that points to these concepts without using any of the forbidden words:

Potential clue: "A child is this in relation to their parents, as they need care, shelter, and financial support."

This clue touches on the concept of reliance/dependency without using any of the forbidden words. It's also short and to the point, as requested due to time pressure.

Let me double-check my clue doesn't contain any forbidden words:
- No mention of "dependent"
- No mention of "dependant"
- No mention of "subordinate"
- No mention of "parasitical"

My clue looks safe and communicates the concept clearly. I'll go with this.

content.text: CLUE: A child is this in relation to their parents, as they need care, shelter, and financial support.

clem_player.response: CLUE: A child is this in relation to their parents, as they need care, shelter, and financial support.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: A child is this in relation to their parents, as they need care, shelter, and financial support.

content.thinking:
The clue is asking about the relationship a child has to their parents in terms of being dependent on them for care, shelter, and financial support.

When a child needs care, shelter, and financial support from their parents, they are:
- A dependent
- A minor
- A offspring

I think the most precise term for this relationship of needing care and support would be "dependent" - which is also the term used in many legal and tax contexts to describe children who rely on their parents.

So my first guess will be "dependent".
